recipes.label: No-One is Coming
recipes.startdescription:
We are no standing army or resistance network; we have no-one to call upon for relief or reinforcement. But this has forced us to adapt.

[You cannot call reinforcements normally, but certain unconventional actions are available to you and your Allies while in Warzones and also in the Ruined Country.]

recipes.label: No-One is Coming
recipes.startdescription:
We are no standing army or resistance network; we have no-one to call upon for relief or reinforcement. But this has forced us to adapt.

[You cannot call reinforcements normally, but certain unconventional actions are available to you and your Allies while in Warzones and also in the Ruined Country.]

recipes.label: Cast Out an Ally
recipes.startdescription: Perhaps we don't have the supplies to drag them any further. Perhaps I can no longer bear the sight of them.
recipes.description: Gone.

recipes.label: Cast Out an Ally
recipes.startdescription: Perhaps we don't have the supplies to drag them any further. Perhaps I can no longer bear the sight of them.
recipes.description: Gone.

recipes.label: Prepare to depart
recipes.startdescription:
The war is waiting for us. Onwards.

[Departing will cut short all actions at the current location and leave behind all Enemies, Complications, Secondary Objectives, and Opportunities. Your travels will take you through the Ruined Country, which is the remote and dangerous waste that lies between your current location and your intended destination.]

recipes.label: Prepare to depart
recipes.startdescription:
The war is waiting for us. Onwards.

[Departing will cut short all actions at the current location and leave behind all Enemies, Complications, Secondary Objectives, and Local Opportunities. Your travels will take you through the Ruined Country, which is the remote and dangerous waste that lies between your current location and your intended destination.]

recipes.label: Prepare to depart
recipes.startdescription:
The war is waiting for us. Onwards.

[Departing will cut short all actions at the current location and leave behind all Enemies, Complications, Secondary Objectives, and Local Opportunities. Your travels will take you through the Ruined Country, which is the remote and dangerous waste that lies between your current location and your intended destination.]

recipes.label: Prepare to depart
recipes.startdescription:
The war is waiting for us. Onwards.

[Departing will cut short all actions at the current location and leave behind all Enemies, Complications, Secondary Objectives, and Local Opportunities. Your travels will take you through the Ruined Country, which is the remote and dangerous waste that lies between your current location and your intended destination.]

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: Pain and Terror
recipes.startdescription: Is this what it all comes to? Will this be the blow that ends me?

recipes.label: Strife!
recipes.startdescription: Battle begets battle. The Corrivality seethes and actuates anew, and so struggle will endure.

recipes.label: A Hunting Party
recipes.startdescription: Kleidouchos hisses from within the confines of her vessel. 'My un-sister has found us. Stand ready.'

recipes.label: A Hunting Party
recipes.startdescription: Kleidouchos hisses from within the confines of her vessel. 'My un-sister has found us. Stand ready.'

recipes.label: Carrion-Call
recipes.startdescription: The scent of kindred blood draws another Insatiable Risen near, and as if ordered, the creature begins to devour -
recipes.description: The starving revenant shudders uncontrollably, licking viscera from what remains of its lips. It screams, choking on blood. More.

recipes.label: A Final Scream
recipes.startdescription: The Wolf-Wrake howls in its horrid un-voice as the end comes over it, thrashing and erupting! Its killer is enveloped in the maelstrom -

recipes.label: A Victory!
recipes.startdescription: The enemy lies broken at our feet, and before this war is over more enemies will follow. This is a good day; this is merely a drop in the ocean.

recipes.label: Collateral!
recipes.startdescription: The meteoric scattergun's broad spread has struck a second target dead!

recipes.label: Meditate on Namehood
recipes.startdescription: I will sleep an unsound sleep, and contemplate my vengeance.

recipes.label: The Wolf's Mysteries...
recipes.startdescription: For a year at Sobibor, the Exile beat and cut the arts of the Wolf into me...
recipes.description: For a year at Sobibor, the Exile beat and cut the arts of the Wolf into me - called it 'my education.' But they didn't teach me everything. I'll need to utterly master the unmaking arts before the Wolf-Divided considers me at all.

recipes.label: A Campaign of Retribution...
recipes.startdescription: Under the black eagle and the hooked cross did I writhe and suffer and starve...
recipes.description: Under the black eagle and the hooked cross did I writhe and suffer and starve, and agony is the gateway to vengeance. Every city I pass on the journey to Berlin must suffer retribution.

recipes.label: A Hatred for All Things...
recipes.startdescription: The Wolf-Divided burns with contempt for all that exists...
recipes.description: The Wolf-Divided burns with contempt for all that exists. A mortal mind cannot comprehend that kind of hate - but because of what I have suffered, I can come very, very close. Hope must die first. Then the rest will follow.

recipes.label: Mark of the Division...
recipes.startdescription: 'CAPUT GERAT LUPINUM. The Sun was divided...'
recipes.description: 'CAPUT GERAT LUPINUM. The Sun was divided, and this is its wound.' I must bear the wolf's head; I must be divided; I must suffer a terrible wound. The instrument that can inflict it waits for me, somewhere on the front.

recipes.label: The Key of Days...
recipes.startdescription: The Key of Days is sacred to all the Solar Hours...
recipes.description: The Key of Days is sacred to all the Solar Hours - even the Wolf-Divided. That Key and that Key alone can open the Door I must pass to be Named. The one who holds it, says the Exile, still lurks in bombed-out Vienna.

recipes.label: The Exile...
recipes.startdescription: Teacher. Torturer. Enemy...
recipes.description: Teacher. Torturer. Enemy. My vengeance will not be complete without this singular, exceptional death. So it is, then, that I must unmake the one who has made me. I will kill the Exile.

recipes.label: A Great Hinge of the Corrivality...
recipes.startdescription: The place where I am to be Named waits in the west...
recipes.description: The place where I am to be Named waits in the west, where the Reich's death scream will sound over the ruins as this war winds to its bloody end. Berlin is where I will seize my destiny.

recipes.label: Hope?
recipes.startdescription: The Exile made revenge seem more than a responsibility...
recipes.description: The Exile made revenge seem more than a responsibility - like I would perish without it. But what if I chose otherwise? What if, at the turning point, I could run from all this instead? Peace never lasts, but war always ends. And hope can persist as long as the soul will permit it.

recipes.label: A Victory!
recipes.startdescription: The guns are falling silent. Our enemies have scattered to the wind. With caution, I slowly begin to register that the battle is over.
recipes.description: And so we are victorious.

recipes.label: A Nightmare of Scars
recipes.startdescription: @#draw.colonel.1|My dream is a perfect stillness. Towers rise in soundless majesty. Streets choke with snow, and the sky is the shade of marble. And the dead - the dead watch and stare, transfixed. The world has gone so beautifully white.#draw.colonel.2|Tonight I dream of dark shapes behind glass. Black sapphire and undulating gristle: these are what we call Worms, and under the chilly shadows of the Worm Museum, they are kept displayed for posterity and to instill fear. It is not safe anywhere in the Mansus, but for one such as me, it is especially unsafe here.@
recipes.description: @#draw.colonel.1|Then there is a betrayal: a shout. And another, and another. Voices rise like fists, defiant. Why? Why now do they break this silence? A great groan of wood and stone - the gates of the city are opening. They have let him in. He is here, and the Sun is behind him. He is here, and though he cannot see, I cannot evade him. And his face - the tattered visage of his face -#draw.colonel.2|An uneven echoing rings through the Museum's silence, like a giant limping across the stones. Dread fills me. I hide myself in a hall where more Nevers and Nothings have been hung for display. Still the echoing comes. When he steps into the hall, I see him at last, and he is all sharp shapes and winter-white excruciation. The length of the room shortens then, and I am brought before him out in the open, weak and naked. My dream ends before I can suffer any mortal harm, but the chill of the Colonel's hand on my shoulder still aches, and aches horribly.@

recipes.label: Leonine Nightmares
recipes.startdescription: @#draw.lionsmith.1|The keen sting of claws in my chest is what I feel first. A feral tabby springs back with a defiant hiss, crouching to lunge again. My hands wrap around its neck to smother it into the dust, but suddenly the cat has become a desert lynx thrashing in my grasp, glaring at me with kerosene lamp eyes as it rears back -#draw.lionsmith.2|Tonight, my dream is a dream of fire. Terrible and nameless weapons illuminate the night sky with their firing, and the field of battle is made a lake of smokeless flame. Below, monsters of all shapes and order stride across that burning lake, slaughtering fleeing men with claw and fang and killing breath. Blood and gold.@
recipes.description: @#draw.lionsmith.1|I try to wrestle it to the ground again, and now it is a lion heaving against me with muscles of riveted iron, then a burning tiger locking its piston-jaws into my flesh. Each moment spent in struggle only doubles the beast's strength and rage. To meet that rage is to feed its fire. And the day will come, perhaps, where I shall find that I am not enough to match it.#draw.lionsmith.2|Over that din of battle - over the screams and the snarling and the thunder of the guns - a proud and fiery laughter rings out. A hundred men and a hundred beasts are then crushed by the advancing footfall of a laughing giant. Then another hundred, and another. Too late, I realize I am in his path - and the dream ends, mercifully. But still I can recall the lake of fire, and firing of the guns, and the shadow cast by that golden giant.@

recipes.label: Omens of the Wolf
recipes.startdescription: @#draw.wolf.1|Tonight, I dream in darkness. No, not darkness - absence. No light, nor gloom; no heat nor cold. Even the borders of my body begin to feel less and less distinct. Perfect oblivion wraps around me like a skin, suffocating me so very sweetly...#draw.wolf.2|It is cold in my dream. Barbed wire posts and train cars are motionless in the winter air. My eyes bore into the dirt at my feet as I settle in, preparing to weather this languid purgatory. Sobibor, at the very least, taught me resiliency.#draw.wolf.3|I dream of my hands around someone's neck. I know this someone - for a year, I felt them trace my skin with the knife and break the bones in my limbs. Exile. My knuckles turn white, and my teeth grit hard enough to crack. My blood is hot with ecstasy.@
recipes.description: @#draw.wolf.1|...and then I wake, and all my aching flesh and creaking bones and biting sorrows return to me. A black rage stirs. How I despise all of this. How I long for relief - but there will be no relief until all the lights are extinguished and all the voices are silenced. This is the impetus of the Wolf, and this morning it burns in me.#draw.wolf.2|I start as a knife clatters to the ground, and my face is taken in rough hands. 'Make it yours,' growls the Wolf. 'Gash and tear and rip at the world and drink what it bleeds. Bring them pain, bring them sorrow, bring them silence - bring them all the miseries that they have left for you. When the world burns on its pyre, you will have your warmth.'#draw.wolf.3|I watch blood and spit surge up from the Exile's throat as I tighten my grip. Their eyes bulge red. The noise they make as their abortive breaths grow thinner and thinner: music. When the light leaves them, I begin to laugh. Then, I wrap my hands around my own throat, and squeeze. I wake gasping. My hands shake.@

recipes.label: Visit a local church to reflect
recipes.startdescription: I am not sure I still quite believe in God, but church's doors are open, and my soul feels heavy. Perhaps a moment here could do me some good. Perhaps.
recipes.description: With a deep breath, I stand up to leave. Too much time alone with one's own mind can make a man sick.

recipes.label: Demand supplies from a local farm
recipes.startdescription: Fighting men must have enough to eat and drink if they are to remain in fighting condition. A forceful visit to the local farm might help us in that matter.
recipes.description: And so we have come to an understanding. The farmer shakes my hand, silent.

recipes.label: Demand supplies from a local farm
recipes.startdescription: Fighting men must have enough to eat and drink if they are to remain in fighting condition. A forceful visit to the local farm might help us in that matter.
recipes.description: And so we have come to an understanding. The farmer shakes my hand, silent.

recipes.label: Something Wicked This Way Comes
recipes.startdescription: Blood-scent and agony-echo so indelibly stain the world here. Strange and terrible enemies sally forth, drawn to the carnage: eager, hungry, hateful.

recipes.label: Something Wicked This Way Comes
recipes.startdescription: Blood-scent and agony-echo so indelibly stain the world here. Strange and terrible enemies sally forth, drawn to the carnage: eager, hungry, hateful.

recipes.label: Convergence and Adversity
recipes.startdescription: The Corrivality burns bright here. Above, the Hours gather in scrutiny and curiosity and disdain. The battlefield prickles with the dangerous power of their attention, tempting curses and afflictions out from the Mansus and into the world. What is to come?

recipes.label: A Feast of Fires
recipes.startdescription: Screams echo in the smoke. I breathe deep, and smile.

recipes.label: A Victory!
recipes.startdescription: The guns are falling silent. Our enemies have scattered to the wind. With caution, I slowly begin to register that the battle is over.
recipes.description: And so we are victorious.

recipes.label: A Victory!
recipes.startdescription: The guns are falling silent. Our enemies have scattered to the wind. With caution, I slowly begin to register that the battle is over.
recipes.description: And so we are victorious.

recipes.label: The Ruptures of Glory
recipes.startdescription: Reality convulses at my mere presence. This one has strayed too close, and the horrid light that leaks from me now takes them -

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
This target is still protected.

[Until all Enemies possessing the Officer's Detail aspect are slain, you cannot attack an Enemy Officer.]

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription: The creature would normally be easy to slay, but despite the weight it now carries within, the Ingluviate remains surprisingly swift - and that's not mentioning the other creatures still protecting it from me.

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription: The creature would normally be easy to slay, but despite the weight it now carries within, the Ingluviate remains surprisingly swift - and that's not mentioning the other creatures still protecting it from me.

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy
recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy
recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.label: A Successful Gambit!
recipes.startdescription: My allies went to their deaths - but the enemy followed after them.

recipes.label: A Failed Gambit!
recipes.startdescription: My allies are dead, and the enemy remains. A wretched waste of time.

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy
recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy
recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Launch a suicidal attack against an enemy
recipes.startdescription:
Die, and take the enemy with you. A strike of desperation.

[All resources dedicated to this attack will be lost. It is not guaranteed to succeed, and a measure as dire as this may dishearten certain Allies and cause them to leave.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.label: Lead a suicidal attack against an enemy?
recipes.startdescription:
We'll die, and hopefully the enemy will die with us. Maybe this is how I want it to end: blood, and then quiet.

[This will probably kill you.]

recipes.label: My Intentions?
recipes.startdescription: I have decided my purpose here already. But, a shadow I carry in my heart beckons me to change that decision...

recipes.label: My Intentions?
recipes.startdescription: How far should I drive the blade? How deeply should I carve my retribution?
recipes.description: My heart quiets. The shadow fades. I swallow my nerves. It will come for my thoughts again.

recipes.label: The Wolf's Work
recipes.startdescription: No wound is deep enough. No retribution far enough.
recipes.description: My hands will be red with the blood of the guilty. Pain will be my purpose. The Wolf has whispered in my ear, and I have listened.

recipes.label: Eluding the Hunt?
recipes.startdescription: Little by little, with every drop of blood shed and enemy slain, the Dry-Witch's talons loosen. But not yet loose enough for escape. Not yet.

recipes.label: Eluding the Hunt?
recipes.startdescription: Little by little, with every drop of blood shed and enemy slain, the Dry-Witch's talons loosen. But not yet loose enough for escape. Not yet.

recipes.label: Eluding the Hunt?
recipes.startdescription: Little by little, with every drop of blood shed and enemy slain, the Dry-Witch's talons loosen. But not yet loose enough for escape. Not yet.

recipes.label: The Deepest of Fears
recipes.startdescription: Echoing footsteps on the stone, a sharp shadow cast upon the wall, a hideous laughter in the night - the monster called Exile is here. And I am afraid.
recipes.description:
Echoing footsteps on the stone, a sharp shadow cast upon the wall, a hideous laughter in the night - the monster called Exile is here. And I am afraid.

[Lingering in the Exile's presence for too long will inflict Trauma upon you - unless you can overcome your fear of them.]

recipes.label: The Deepest of Fears
recipes.startdescription: The Exile stands before me, all too real, eager to hurt me again and again and again until I am no more. And I am afraid.
recipes.description:
The Exile stands before me, all too real, eager to hurt me again and again and again until I am no more. And I am afraid.

[Lingering in the Exile's presence for too long will inflict Trauma upon you - unless you can overcome your fear of them.]

recipes.label: The Trial Awaits Within
recipes.startdescription: As the Ligeian said, I will have to go inwards to find my answer to fear. None will be able to follow me: not my enemies, not those claiming to be my allies - no-one. Alone will I walk into the darkness, and at some point, the line between waking and dreaming will cease to be.
recipes.description: I have travelled west thus far, yet I find myself back east. The gate swings wide. I hear a train grind haltingly on distant railroad tracks. Here again.

recipes.label: The Trial Awaits Within
recipes.startdescription: I have travelled west thus far, yet I find myself back east. The gate swings wide. I hear a train grind haltingly on distant railroad tracks. Here again.

recipes.label: The Trial Awaits Within
recipes.startdescription: I have travelled west thus far, yet I find myself back east. The gate swings wide. I hear a train grind haltingly on distant railroad tracks. Here again.

recipes.label: The Trial Awaits Within
recipes.startdescription: I have travelled west thus far, yet I find myself back east. The gate swings wide. I hear a train grind haltingly on distant railroad tracks. Here again.

recipes.label: Dream of the End
recipes.startdescription:
The Wolf's hatred is a stark, fathomless pit, accepting all things and returning nothing. But I could dream unwisely - I could look over the edge of creation into that pit, and see what looks back into me.

[This will produce Trauma, and may also wound you.]
recipes.description: Nothing. Nothing stares back at me. I begin to scream.

recipes.label: On Wings of Wrath
recipes.startdescription: A shadow crosses the sun. It is blindingly fast - a shape bigger than a man, scaled and winged and clawed, falls upon the Edge-Long and rends at their immortal flesh. The bizarre ambush forces the Long back, giving me time to breathe. Could that have been one of the fabled Cross? No - they all vanished from the world when Flesh conquered Stone, when ape conquered beetle. Didn't they?

recipes.label: On Wings of Wrath
recipes.startdescription: A shadow crosses the sun. It is blindingly fast - a shape bigger than a man, scaled and winged and clawed, falls upon the Edge-Long and rends at their immortal flesh. The bizarre ambush forces the Long back, giving me time to breathe. Could that have been one of the fabled Cross? No - they all vanished from the world when Flesh conquered Stone, when ape conquered beetle. Didn't they?

recipes.label: Retreat!
recipes.startdescription: The strength of the Edge-Long proves just enough to drive off the carapaced assailant. The creature, routed, flees the field and back behind the sky - but thankfully, the Edge-Long will need time to recover before coming after me again. Best to get a head start if I plan on leaving alive.

recipes.label: No Defense!
recipes.startdescription: My mind reels. My soul begins to splinter.

recipes.label: No Defense!
recipes.startdescription: The pain of an entire year's worth of torture floods back; an entire year of the Exile forcing their pains and truths onto me, and into me. My hands want to rip my dreaming brain from my skull, but I bite back the instinct. Not. Yet.

recipes.label: A Victory!
recipes.startdescription: There you are.
